ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: The senior capstone project taught me how to apply academic knowledge to the real world. This course helped me to develop my research, writing, communication, teamwork, and presentation skills through the lens of a fascinating subject related to Global Affairs.

I learned how to be diplomatic and a leader in a team/group setting. I gained real world experiences by working with a public health non-profit. Through this experience, I developed a deeper understanding of how extremism manifests and develops in today's digital age.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Flexibility is both the greatest strength and greatest weakness of the senior capstone project. In my group the students were the driving force behind essentially all major decisions beyond the initial scope of our task. This meant that I worked at a pace decided by the group, and worked on tasks that I wanted. This was helpful for my own intellectual curiosity and schedule but dangerous since my group ultimately fell behind in the last month of the semester, and at times made decisions I didn't fully agree with.

I think the course topic is very broad, which gives students a great opportunity to dive deep into the topic. However, I think it would be helpful to have a more general structure with the course in the beginning. For example: A weekly plan or table of contents overview/timeline of topics and tasks, that is developed by the professor so that students have a more clear expectation of how the course will develop throughout the semester. Then, with this foundation/skeleton, students can flesh it out more as a group, as well as with the professor. With this, students will have a more clear footing from the beginning of the semester and can feel more confident in the direction that they are going in.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this senior capstone project to any student interested in countering violent extremism. My group applied lessons that we had learned in global affairs classes to create a real-world solution to one aspect of violent extremism.
Yes! The challenges make the course worth it because you are pushing yourself to grow as a thinker and leader.
